@graph.rdfs:comment: The textual content of this CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: text

@graph.rdfs:comment: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: alternativeHeadline

@graph.rdfs:comment: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.
@graph.rdfs:label: interactivityType

@graph.rdfs:comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: encodings

@graph.rdfs:comment: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.
@graph.rdfs:label: accessModeSufficient

@graph.rdfs:comment: An embedded video object.
@graph.rdfs:label: video

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates a page documenting how licenses can be purchased or otherwise acquired, for the current item.
@graph.rdfs:label: acquireLicensePage

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.
@graph.rdfs:label: schemaVersion

@graph.rdfs:comment: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
@graph.rdfs:label: additionalType

@graph.rdfs:comment: A review of the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: review

@graph.rdfs:comment: The cuisine of the recipe (for example, French or Ethiopian).
@graph.rdfs:label: recipeCuisine

@graph.rdfs:comment: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.
@graph.rdfs:label: author

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
@graph.rdfs:label: potentialAction

@graph.rdfs:comment: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.
@graph.rdfs:label: workExample

@graph.rdfs:comment: A resource from which this work is derived or from which it is a modification or adaption.
@graph.rdfs:label: isBasedOn

@graph.rdfs:comment: Fictional person connected with a creative work.
@graph.rdfs:label: character

@graph.rdfs:comment: A description of the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: description

@graph.rdfs:comment: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.
@graph.rdfs:label: estimatedCost

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a VideoObject or NewsArticle whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a ClaimReview fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.
@graph.rdfs:label: expires

@graph.rdfs:comment: The publisher of the creative work.
@graph.rdfs:label: publisher

@graph.rdfs:comment: Comments, typically from users.
@graph.rdfs:label: comment

@graph.rdfs:comment: Awards won by or for this item.
@graph.rdfs:label: awards

@graph.rdfs:comment: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.
@graph.rdfs:label: isAccessibleForFree

@graph.rdfs:comment: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.
@graph.rdfs:label: thumbnailUrl

@graph.rdfs:comment: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.
@graph.rdfs:label: genre

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: accountablePerson

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe or menu item is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: suitableForDiet

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
@graph.rdfs:label: accessibilityControl

@graph.rdfs:comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.
@graph.rdfs:label: funder

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.
@graph.rdfs:label: isPartOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: A publication event associated with the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: publication

@graph.rdfs:comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.
@graph.rdfs:label: provider

@graph.rdfs:comment: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.
@graph.rdfs:label: version

@graph.rdfs:comment: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.
@graph.rdfs:label: fileFormat

@graph.rdfs:comment: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.
@graph.rdfs:label: contributor

@graph.rdfs:comment: The quantity that results by performing instructions. For example, a paper airplane, 10 personalized candles.
@graph.rdfs:label: yield

@graph.rdfs:comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).
@graph.rdfs:label: steps

@graph.rdfs:comment: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
@graph.rdfs:label: accessibilityHazard

@graph.rdfs:comment: The publishing division which published the comic.
The specific time described by a creative work, for works (e.g. articles, video objects etc.) that emphasise a particular moment within an Event.
@graph.rdfs:label: contentReferenceTime

@graph.rdfs:comment: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.
@graph.rdfs:label: accessMode

@graph.rdfs:comment: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.
@graph.rdfs:label: educationalUse

@graph.rdfs:comment: Review of the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: reviews

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, an item. Typically used for real world items such as an ArchiveComponent held by an ArchiveOrganization. This property is not suitable for use as a general Web access control mechanism. It is expressed only in natural language.

For example "Available by appointment from the Reading Room" or "Accessible only from logged-in accounts ".
@graph.rdfs:label: conditionsOfAccess

@graph.rdfs:comment: An abstract is a short description that summarizes a CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: abstract

@graph.rdfs:comment: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).
@graph.rdfs:label: producer

@graph.rdfs:comment: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
@graph.rdfs:label: image

@graph.rdfs:comment: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.
@graph.rdfs:label: contentLocation

@graph.rdfs:comment: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.
@graph.rdfs:label: typicalAgeRange

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.
@graph.rdfs:label: mainEntityOfPage

@graph.rdfs:comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.
@graph.rdfs:label: audience

@graph.rdfs:comment: An alias for the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: alternateName

@graph.rdfs:comment: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.
@graph.rdfs:label: sameAs

@graph.rdfs:comment: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.
@graph.rdfs:label: exampleOfWork

@graph.rdfs:comment: A maintainer of a Dataset, software package (SoftwareApplication), or other Project. A maintainer is a Person or Organization that manages contributions to, and/or publication of, some (typically complex) artifact. It is common for distributions of software and data to be based on "upstream" sources. When maintainer is applied to a specific version of something e.g. a particular version or packaging of a Dataset, it is always possible that the upstream source has a different maintainer. The isBasedOn property can be used to indicate such relationships between datasets to make the different maintenance roles clear. Similarly in the case of software, a package may have dedicated maintainers working on integration into software distributions such as Ubuntu, as well as upstream maintainers of the underlying work.
@graph.rdfs:label: maintainer

@graph.rdfs:comment: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.
@graph.rdfs:label: position

@graph.rdfs:comment: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
@graph.rdfs:label: accessibilityFeature

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: mainEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: The time it takes to actually cook the dish, in ISO 8601 duration format.
@graph.rdfs:label: cookTime

@graph.rdfs:comment: The work that this work has been translated from. e.g. 物种起源 is a translationOf “On the Origin of Species”
The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in ISO 8601 duration format.
@graph.rdfs:label: performTime

@graph.rdfs:comment: The quantity of the materials being described or an expression of the physical space they occupy.
Indicates a correction to a CreativeWork, either via a CorrectionComment, textually or in another document.
@graph.rdfs:label: correction

@graph.rdfs:comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.
@graph.rdfs:label: dateCreated

@graph.rdfs:comment: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."
@graph.rdfs:label: accessibilitySummary

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The schema.org usageInfo property indicates further information about a CreativeWork. This property is applicable both to works that are freely available and to those that require payment or other transactions. It can reference additional information e.g. community expectations on preferred linking and citation conventions, as well as purchasing details. For something that can be commercially licensed, usageInfo can provide detailed, resource-specific information about licensing options.

This property can be used alongside the license property which indicates license(s) applicable to some piece of content. The usageInfo property can provide information about other licensing options, e.g. acquiring commercial usage rights for an image that is also available under non-commercial creative commons licenses.
@graph.rdfs:label: usageInfo

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates the date on which the current structured data was generated / published. Typically used alongside sdPublisher
@graph.rdfs:label: sdDatePublished

@graph.rdfs:comment: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.
@graph.rdfs:label: recipeIngredient

@graph.rdfs:comment: A step in making the recipe, in the form of a single item (document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.
@graph.rdfs:label: recipeInstructions

@graph.rdfs:comment: Headline of the article.
@graph.rdfs:label: headline

@graph.rdfs:comment: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in ISO 8601 duration format.
@graph.rdfs:label: totalTime

@graph.rdfs:comment: The method of cooking, such as Frying, Steaming, ...
@graph.rdfs:label: cookingMethod

@graph.rdfs:comment: The "spatial" property can be used in cases when more specific properties (e.g. locationCreated, spatialCoverage, contentLocation) are not known to be appropriate.
@graph.rdfs:label: spatial

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).
@graph.rdfs:label: hasPart

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: editor

@graph.rdfs:comment: The name of the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: copyrightHolder

@graph.rdfs:comment: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.
@graph.rdfs:label: identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see IANA site and MDN reference) e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.).

In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, encoding can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular encodingFormat information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.
@graph.rdfs:label: encodingFormat

@graph.rdfs:comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection.
@graph.rdfs:label: step

@graph.rdfs:comment: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: locationCreated

@graph.rdfs:comment: An award won by or for this item.
@graph.rdfs:label: award

@graph.rdfs:comment: The most generic type of item.
@graph.rdfs:label: Thing

@graph.rdfs:comment: Instructions that explain how to achieve a result by performing a sequence of steps.
@graph.rdfs:label: HowTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing.
@graph.rdfs:label: subjectOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.
@graph.rdfs:label: ingredients

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.
@graph.rdfs:label: mentions

@graph.rdfs:comment: The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).
@graph.rdfs:label: recipeYield

@graph.rdfs:comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.
@graph.rdfs:label: associatedMedia

@graph.rdfs:comment: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.
@graph.rdfs:label: supply

@graph.rdfs:comment: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.
@graph.rdfs:label: license

@graph.rdfs:comment: Nutrition information about the recipe or menu item.
@graph.rdfs:label: nutrition

@graph.rdfs:comment: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: creator

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.
@graph.rdfs:label: isFamilyFriendly

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format. In the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL. Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.
@graph.rdfs:label: temporalCoverage

@graph.rdfs:comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.
@graph.rdfs:label: isBasedOnUrl

@graph.rdfs:comment: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.
@graph.rdfs:label: commentCount

@graph.rdfs:comment: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: CreativeWork

@graph.rdfs:comment: URL of the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: url

@graph.rdfs:comment: A work that is a translation of the content of this work. e.g. 西遊記 has an English workTranslation “Journey to the West”,a German workTranslation “Monkeys Pilgerfahrt” and a Vietnamese  translation Tây du ký bình khảo.
The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.
@graph.rdfs:label: sourceOrganization

@graph.rdfs:comment: The subject matter of the content.
@graph.rdfs:label: about

@graph.rdfs:comment: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
@graph.rdfs:label: disambiguatingDescription

@graph.rdfs:comment: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'PT30M', 'PT1H25M'.
@graph.rdfs:label: timeRequired

@graph.rdfs:comment: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.
@graph.rdfs:label: tool

@graph.rdfs:comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.
@graph.rdfs:label: encoding

@graph.rdfs:comment: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.
@graph.rdfs:label: keywords

@graph.rdfs:comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.
@graph.rdfs:label: sponsor

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of first broadcast/publication.
@graph.rdfs:label: datePublished

@graph.rdfs:comment: A recipe. For dietary restrictions covered by the recipe, a few common restrictions are enumerated via suitableForDiet. The keywords property can also be used to add more detail.
@graph.rdfs:label: Recipe

@graph.rdfs:comment: The category of the recipe—for example, appetizer, entree, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: recipeCategory

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.
@graph.rdfs:label: spatialCoverage

@graph.rdfs:comment: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: citation

@graph.rdfs:comment: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: discussionUrl

@graph.rdfs:comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.
@graph.rdfs:label: aggregateRating

@graph.rdfs:comment: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.
@graph.rdfs:label: releasedEvent

@graph.rdfs:comment: A license document that applies to this structured data, typically indicated by URL.
@graph.rdfs:label: sdLicense

@graph.rdfs:comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.
@graph.rdfs:label: dateModified

@graph.rdfs:comment: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.
@graph.rdfs:label: learningResourceType

@graph.rdfs:comment: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in ISO 8601 duration format.
@graph.rdfs:label: prepTime

@graph.rdfs:comment: An alignment to an established educational framework.
@graph.rdfs:label: educationalAlignment

@graph.rdfs:comment: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.
@graph.rdfs:label: contentRating

@graph.rdfs:comment: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.
@graph.rdfs:label: interactionStatistic

@graph.rdfs:comment: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.
@graph.rdfs:label: translator

@graph.rdfs:comment: An embedded audio object.
@graph.rdfs:label: audio

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).
@graph.rdfs:label: accessibilityAPI

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates the party responsible for generating and publishing the current structured data markup, typically in cases where the structured data is derived automatically from existing published content but published on a different site. For example, student projects and open data initiatives often re-publish existing content with more explicitly structured metadata. The sdPublisher property helps make such practices more explicit.
@graph.rdfs:label: sdPublisher

@graph.rdfs:comment: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.
@graph.rdfs:label: material

@graph.rdfs:comment: The status of a creative work in terms of its stage in a lifecycle. Example terms include Incomplete, Draft, Published, Obsolete. Some organizations define a set of terms for the stages of their publication lifecycle.
@graph.rdfs:label: creativeWorkStatus

@graph.rdfs:comment: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.
@graph.rdfs:label: recordedAt

@graph.rdfs:comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use businessFunction to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a Demand. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.
@graph.rdfs:label: offers

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via URL) a document describing the editorial principles of an Organization (or individual e.g. a Person writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a CreativeWork (e.g. NewsArticle) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a funder) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.
@graph.rdfs:label: publishingPrinciples

@graph.rdfs:comment: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.
@graph.rdfs:label: copyrightYear

@graph.rdfs:comment: The "temporal" property can be used in cases where more specific properties (e.g. temporalCoverage, dateCreated, dateModified, datePublished) are not known to be appropriate.
@graph.rdfs:label: temporal

@graph.rdfs:comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.
@graph.rdfs:label: inLanguage
